summary: This is an email chain from September 11, 2019, regarding the booking of travel for an Epstein victim to fly from Palm Beach, Florida, to New York City to meet with the Epstein prosecution team (AUSAs and agents) on September 12, 2019. The travel is to be paid for with USAO funds.

persons.name: Epstein victim
persons.context: An unnamed victim of Jeffrey Epstein who is being flown from Palm Beach to New York to meet with the prosecution team for an interview.

events.title: Victim Interview with Prosecution Team
events.description: An Epstein victim is scheduled to meet with the Epstein team of AUSAs and agents at 5pm in the SDNY.

events.title: Travel to New York
events.description: An Epstein victim flies from Palm Beach, FL, to New York City for a meeting with prosecutors.

events.title: Return Travel to Palm Beach
events.description: The Epstein victim is scheduled to fly back to Palm Beach, FL, after staying overnight in a hotel.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) approved the use of its funds to pay for an Epstein victim's travel for an interview.
The victim was to be interviewed by the 'Epstein team of AUSAs and agents' in the Southern District of New York on September 12, 2019.
The email demonstrates active witness coordination and victim outreach by federal prosecutors in the Epstein case shortly after his death in August 2019.
The victim's personal details (full name, DOB, email) are referenced but redacted in the provided text.
The travel involved a flight, hotel stay, and return flight, indicating formal arrangements for witness testimony.
